intro: Panicum scandens, commonly known as silverleaf panicgrass, is a perennial grass native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its delicate, silver-gray foliage and slender, arching stems that often form dense clumps. The plant produces fluffy, pale green to brownish seed heads that mature in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils. Panicum scandens is often used in ornamental landscaping for its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
